filmography.title: The Big Broadcast of 1938
filmography.role_description: A radio announcer who hosts a transatlantic race between two ocean liners; the film where Hope introduced his signature song, 'Thanks for the Memory'.
filmography.plot: Two ocean liners race across the Atlantic while a variety of radio stars perform musical numbers.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win - Best Original Song ('Thanks for the Memory')

filmography.title: The Cat and the Canary
filmography.role_description: A wisecracking radio actor who tries to protect an heiress from a killer in a spooky mansion.
filmography.plot: An heiress must spend the night in a haunted house to inherit a fortune, while a maniac escapes from a nearby asylum.

filmography.title: Road to Singapore
filmography.role_description: A wealthy playboy's son who flees to Singapore with his best friend to escape marriage and work.
filmography.plot: Two playboys renounce women and hide out in Singapore, only to both fall for the same beautiful dancer.

filmography.title: The Ghost Breakers
filmography.role_description: A radio broadcaster fleeing mobsters who helps an heiress investigate her haunted castle in Cuba.
filmography.plot: A radio reporter and an heiress travel to a small island off Cuba to inherit a castle that is reportedly haunted.

filmography.title: Road to Zanzibar
filmography.role_description: A carnival performer who gets conned into funding a diamond mine expedition in Africa.
filmography.plot: Two sideshow performers travel across Africa, getting involved with diamond mines and two women looking for a rich husband.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Caught in the Draft
filmography.role_description: A cowardly movie star who accidentally enlists in the Army while trying to impress a colonel's daughter.
filmography.plot: A pampered actor tries to avoid the draft by marrying a general's daughter, but ends up in boot camp anyway.

filmography.title: Nothing But the Truth
filmography.role_description: A stockbroker who makes a high-stakes bet that he can tell the absolute truth for 24 hours.
filmography.plot: A man bets $10,000 that he can tell nothing but the truth for twenty-four hours, creating chaos in his personal and professional life.

filmography.title: My Favorite Blonde
filmography.role_description: A vaudeville penguin trainer who gets entangled in an espionage plot with a beautiful British agent.
filmography.plot: A vaudevillian helps a spy smuggle a secret code across the country while trying to keep his penguin act together.

filmography.title: Road to Morocco
filmography.role_description: A stowaway who is sold into slavery by his best friend and ends up engaged to a princess.
filmography.plot: Two castaways wash up on the shores of Morocco and get involved with an Arabian princess and a desert sheik.

filmography.title: The Princess and the Pirate
filmography.role_description: A cowardly actor traveling under a false name who tries to save a princess from a ruthless pirate.
filmography.plot: A timid entertainer helps a princess escape a pirate king and disguise herself as a commoner.

filmography.title: Road to Utopia
filmography.role_description: A vaudeville performer who finds a map to a gold mine and heads to Alaska with his partner.
filmography.plot: Two vaudevillians fake their identities to claim a gold mine in the Klondike, but bad guys are hot on their trail.

filmography.title: Monsieur Beaucaire
filmography.role_description: The royal barber to King Louis XV who impersonates a nobleman to escape punishment.
filmography.plot: A barber in the court of Louis XV gets mixed up in court intrigue and has to impersonate a duke.

filmography.title: My Favorite Brunette
filmography.role_description: A baby photographer on death row who recounts how he was mistaken for a private eye and framed for murder.
filmography.plot: A photographer dreaming of being a detective gets his wish when he's mistaken for one by a mysterious woman.

filmography.title: Road to Rio
filmography.role_description: A musician who stows away on a ship to Brazil and helps a woman escape a hypnotist's control.
filmography.plot: Two musicians stow away on a ship to Rio de Janeiro and help a woman who is being hypnotized into an unwanted marriage.

filmography.title: The Paleface
filmography.role_description: A timid dentist in the Wild West who unwittingly marries Calamity Jane and becomes a hero.
filmography.plot: Calamity Jane marries a cowardly dentist as a cover while she hunts for gunrunners, making him look like a hero.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win - Best Original Song ('Buttons and Bows')

filmography.title: Sorrowful Jones
filmography.role_description: A cheap bookie who accidentally becomes the guardian of a young girl left as a gambling marker.
filmography.plot: A bookie finds himself caring for a little girl when her father leaves her as collateral for a bet and doesn't return.

filmography.title: The Great Lover
filmography.role_description: A reporter chaperoning a boy scout troop on a cruise who tries to romance a duchess while dodging a serial killer.
filmography.plot: A scout leader on a cruise ship tries to woo a duchess while being targeted by a card-shark murderer.

filmography.title: Fancy Pants
filmography.role_description: An American actor posing as a refined British butler who is brought to the Wild West to teach etiquette.
filmography.plot: An actor posing as an English butler is brought to New Mexico to refine a wealthy family, but the deception falls apart.
filmography.awards: Remake of Ruggles of Red Gap

filmography.title: The Lemon Drop Kid
filmography.role_description: A con man who owes money to a gangster and starts a fake Christmas charity to pay him back; introduced the song 'Silver Bells'.
filmography.plot: A racetrack tout has until Christmas to pay back a gangster, so he organizes a scam using street-corner Santas.

filmography.title: My Favorite Spy
filmography.role_description: A burlesque comic who is a dead ringer for a suave international spy and is recruited to impersonate him.
filmography.plot: The US government recruits a comedian to pose as a spy in Tangier to retrieve a microfilm.

filmography.title: Son of Paleface
filmography.role_description: The Harvard-educated son of 'Painless' Potter who heads west to claim his father's gold but finds only debts.
filmography.plot: Junior Potter returns to the West to find his father's fortune, but instead finds trouble with outlaws and the government.

filmography.title: Road to Bali
filmography.role_description: A vaudeville performer who becomes a deep-sea diver in Bali to hunt for treasure with his partner.
filmography.plot: Two song-and-dance men leave Australia for Bali to work as divers and find themselves competing for a princess's affection.

filmography.title: Casanova's Big Night
filmography.role_description: A lowly tailor who impersonates the legendary lover Casanova to help him escape his creditors.
filmography.plot: A tailor impersonates Casanova to test the fidelity of a woman, but gets caught up in political intrigue.

filmography.title: The Seven Little Foys
filmography.role_description: The famous vaudevillian who struggles to balance his career with raising his seven children after his wife dies.
filmography.plot: A biography of vaudeville entertainer Eddie Foy, who integrates his seven children into his act.

filmography.title: The Iron Petticoat
filmography.role_description: An American pilot tasked with converting a defecting Soviet pilot to capitalism and democracy.
filmography.plot: A Russian female pilot defects to the West, and an American Major tries to woo her to democracy and himself.

filmography.title: Beau James
filmography.role_description: The flamboyant and controversial Mayor of New York City during the Jazz Age in this biopic.
filmography.plot: The life and times of Jimmy Walker, the popular but scandalous mayor of New York City in the 1920s.

filmography.title: Alias Jesse James
filmography.role_description: An inept insurance agent who sells a life insurance policy to Jesse James and must keep him alive to save his job.
filmography.plot: An insurance salesman goes west to protect his client, outlaw Jesse James, so the company won't have to pay out.

filmography.title: The Facts of Life
filmography.role_description: A married man who falls in love with his best friend's wife during a vacation, leading to a complicated affair.
filmography.plot: Two middle-aged, married suburbanites have an affair and try to decide whether to leave their spouses.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination - Best Original Screenplay; Golden Globe: Nomination - Best Actor

filmography.title: Bachelor in Paradise
filmography.role_description: A writer of bachelor guidebooks who moves into a suburban community to research the American housewife.
filmography.plot: A bachelor author moves to a California suburb to research a book, causing chaos among the local husbands and wives.

filmography.title: The Road to Hong Kong
filmography.role_description: A con man who loses his memory and gets involved in a spy plot involving secret rocket fuel formulas.
filmography.plot: Bob and Bing return for one last road trip, getting mixed up with spies and space travel in Hong Kong.

filmography.title: How to Commit Marriage
filmography.role_description: A man who decides to divorce his wife just as their daughter announces her engagement, leading to generational conflict.
filmography.plot: A couple plans to divorce but puts it on hold for their daughter's wedding, only to find their daughter plans to live in sin.

filmography.title: Cancel My Reservation
filmography.role_description: A stressed TV talk show host who goes to Arizona for a rest and gets framed for murder; Hope's final starring film role.
filmography.plot: A TV personality takes a vacation to a ranch in Arizona and gets involved in a murder mystery involving a land dispute.
